intro: Conioselinum nematophyllum, commonly known as the slender umbellifer, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to southern Europe, this plant thrives in moist, calcareous soils. It typically grows in open woodlands and along streambanks. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
